fear.bodyLanguage: Head and eyes up, shoulders back but relaxed. Assertive.
fear.oppositeAction: Do something you know will give you a sense of control & mastery.

anger.options: anger, angry, mad, pissed off, pissed
anger.bodyLanguage: Unclench hands. Relax chest and stomach. Unclench teeth. Relax face, half smile.
anger.oppositeAction: Take a time out. Be kind. Be understanding.
anger.breathing: Breath in deeply and out slowly. Or go for a sprint if you can.

envy.bodyLanguage: Unclench hands. Relax chest and stomach. Unclench teeth. Relax face, half smile.
envy.oppositeAction: Think of 3 blessings / things you are thankful for.

jealous.bodyLanguage: Unclench hands. Relax chest and stomach. Unclench teeth. Relax face, half smile.
jealous.oppositeAction: Let go of controlling others actions. Share the things and people you have in your life.

sad.bodyLanguage: Adopt a bright posture. Head up, eyes open, shoulders back.
sad.oppositeAction: Don't avoid. Be mindful of sadness but also increase pleasant events.

shame.bodyLanguage: Look innocent and proud. Lift your head. Proud chest. Maintain eye contact. Keep your voice tone steady and clear.
shame.oppositeAction: Don't appologize. Take in all information. Repeat the behavior to build tolerance.

guilt.bodyLanguage: Look innocent and proud. Lift your head. Proud chest. Maintain eye contact. Keep your voice tone steady and clear.
guilt.oppositeAction: Don't appologize. Take in all information. Repeat the behavior to build tolerance.

stress.bodyLanguage: Look innocent and proud. Lift your head. Proud chest. Maintain eye contact. Keep your voice tone steady and clear.
stress.oppositeAction: Don't appologize. Take in all information. Repeat the behavior to build tolerance.

anxiety.bodyLanguage: Look innocent and proud. Lift your head. Proud chest. Maintain eye contact. Keep your voice tone steady and clear.
anxiety.oppositeAction: Don't appologize. Take in all information. Repeat the behavior to build tolerance.

happy.bodyLanguage: Look innocent and proud. Lift your head. Proud chest. Maintain eye contact. Keep your voice tone steady and clear.
happy.oppositeAction: Don't appologize. Take in all information. Repeat the behavior to build tolerance.
